events.name: Russian Missile Strikes Cause Blackout in Kharkiv
events.wd_label: Russian Missile Strikes Cause Blackout in Kharkiv
events.wd_description: A wave of Russian missile strikes targeted energy stations across Ukraine, causing a blackout in Kharkiv. Despite the damage, electricity was partially restored, and air defenses intercepted most of the missiles.
events.description: A wave of Russian missile strikes targeted energy stations across Ukraine, causing a blackout in Kharkiv. Despite the damage, electricity was partially restored, and air defenses intercepted most of the missiles.

events.name: Missile Strikes on Energy Stations
events.wd_description: Russian forces launched 76 missiles and drone attacks targeting energy stations across Ukraine, with significant damage reported in Kharkiv.
events.description: Russian forces launched 76 missiles and drone attacks targeting energy stations across Ukraine, with significant damage reported in Kharkiv.

events.name: Blackout in Kharkiv
events.wd_description: The missile strikes caused a blackout in Kharkiv, affecting power supplies to a large portion of the city's residents and the northeastern region.
events.description: The missile strikes caused a blackout in Kharkiv, affecting power supplies to a large portion of the city's residents and the northeastern region.

events.name: Restoration Efforts
events.wd_description: Local officials and emergency services worked to restore electricity, successfully restoring power to 55% of Kharkiv's residents and 85% in the region.
events.description: Local officials and emergency services worked to restore electricity, successfully restoring power to 55% of Kharkiv's residents and 85% in the region.

events.name: Air Defense Response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian air defenses intercepted 60 of the 76 missiles fired by Russia, with most of the intercepted missiles being cruise missiles.
events.description: Ukrainian air defenses intercepted 60 of the 76 missiles fired by Russia, with most of the intercepted missiles being cruise missiles.

events.name: UK Approves First Coal Mining Operation in 30 Years
events.wd_label: UK Approves First Coal Mining Operation in 30 Years
events.wd_description: The UK government approved its first coal mining operation in 30 years, a move criticized for potentially jeopardizing the country's climate change targets, as the mine is intended for steel production rather than electricity generation.
events.description: The UK government approved its first coal mining operation in 30 years, a move criticized for potentially jeopardizing the country's climate change targets, as the mine is intended for steel production rather than electricity generation.

events.name: Approval of Coal Mine
events.wd_description: The UK government approved a new coal mining operation, the first in 30 years, with the coal intended for steel manufacturing and backed by 40 conservative MPs.
events.description: The UK government approved a new coal mining operation, the first in 30 years, with the coal intended for steel manufacturing and backed by 40 conservative MPs.

events.name: Climate Change Concerns
events.wd_description: Critics, including environmental experts, warned that the new coal mine could significantly hinder the UK's efforts to meet its climate change goals, particularly reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
events.description: Critics, including environmental experts, warned that the new coal mine could significantly hinder the UK's efforts to meet its climate change goals, particularly reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

events.name: Impact on Greenhouse Gas Emissions Targets
events.wd_label: Impact on Greenhouse Gas Emissions Targets
events.wd_description: The UK Climate Change Committee (UKCCC) highlighted the risk that the coal mine poses to the UK's target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 78% by 2035, warning of the need for costly emissions capture and disposal if coal use continues.
events.description: The UK Climate Change Committee (UKCCC) highlighted the risk that the coal mine poses to the UK's target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 78% by 2035, warning of the need for costly emissions capture and disposal if coal use continues.

events.name: Liberation of Lyman by Ukrainian Troops
events.wd_label: Liberation of Lyman by Ukrainian Troops
events.wd_description: Ukrainian forces liberated the key eastern city of Lyman, marking another military defeat for Russia, just after Russia had declared the city's annexation.
events.description: Ukrainian forces liberated the key eastern city of Lyman, marking another military defeat for Russia, just after Russia had declared the city's annexation.

events.name: Liberation of Lyman
events.wd_description: Ukrainian troops surrounded and captured Lyman, raising the national flag and celebrating their victory over Russian forces.
events.description: Ukrainian troops surrounded and captured Lyman, raising the national flag and celebrating their victory over Russian forces.

events.name: Russian Retreat
events.wd_description: Russia's ministry of defense acknowledged the retreat of its troops from Lyman, citing the need to move to "more advantageous lines."
events.description: Russia's ministry of defense acknowledged the retreat of its troops from Lyman, citing the need to move to "more advantageous lines."

events.name: Annexation Ceremony
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared Lyman and other regions as part of Russia during a ceremony in the Kremlin, despite the ongoing conflict.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared Lyman and other regions as part of Russia during a ceremony in the Kremlin, despite the ongoing conflict.

events.name: Canada's Battery-Supply Chain Prowess and Investments
events.wd_label: Canada's Battery-Supply Chain Prowess and Investments
events.wd_description: Canada has risen in BloombergNEF's global ranking of battery-producing countries, second only to China, due to significant investments in critical mineral mining, battery component manufacturing, and EV production.
events.description: Canada has risen in BloombergNEF's global ranking of battery-producing countries, second only to China, due to significant investments in critical mineral mining, battery component manufacturing, and EV production.

events.name: BloombergNEF Ranking
events.wd_description: Canada's position in BloombergNEF's global ranking improved to second place, reflecting its strong presence in the battery supply chain industry.
events.description: Canada's position in BloombergNEF's global ranking improved to second place, reflecting its strong presence in the battery supply chain industry.

events.name: Federal Investments
events.wd_description: Over the past 10 months, Canada has announced more than $15 billion in investments in critical mineral mining, battery component manufacturing, and EV production.
events.description: Over the past 10 months, Canada has announced more than $15 billion in investments in critical mineral mining, battery component manufacturing, and EV production.

events.name: International Outreach
events.wd_description: Federal Innovation Minister François-Philippe Champagne is visiting Asia, Japan, South Korea, and Germany to consolidate relationships and promote Canada's battery-supply chain capabilities.
events.description: Federal Innovation Minister François-Philippe Champagne is visiting Asia, Japan, South Korea, and Germany to consolidate relationships and promote Canada's battery-supply chain capabilities.

events.name: Supply Chain Links
events.wd_description: The battery-supply chain includes raw material mining, refining, component manufacturing, and battery cell production, culminating in gigafactories producing battery packs.
events.description: The battery-supply chain includes raw material mining, refining, component manufacturing, and battery cell production, culminating in gigafactories producing battery packs.

events.name: Environmental Stewardship
events.wd_description: Canada receives high marks for keeping the supply chain green due to its renewable energy resources and environmental regulations on mining.
events.description: Canada receives high marks for keeping the supply chain green due to its renewable energy resources and environmental regulations on mining.

events.name: Efforts to Limit China's Influence
events.wd_description: Canada is taking steps to limit China's influence in the domestic supply chain, including ordering Chinese companies to sell their interests in Canadian firms and limiting foreign-owned state companies' involvement in the critical mineral sector.
events.description: Canada is taking steps to limit China's influence in the domestic supply chain, including ordering Chinese companies to sell their interests in Canadian firms and limiting foreign-owned state companies' involvement in the critical mineral sector.
